group_1.textLeft: I'll start with some background information.
My family runs the Ryushinkan, a kendo@dojo in Mizuna.

group_1.textRight: Oh I've heard of them!@Little miss fancy pants!

group_1.textLeft: One of my older cousins trained there too.
So you'll take the exam@once you finish college, Sir?

group_1.textRight: I keep telling you not to call me that.@It sounds so formal...

group_1.textLeft: Don't worry about it! It's important to @have manners, even within the family!

group_1.textRight: All right, so I'll call you Madame in @that case.

group_1.textLeft: You're my elder, Sir!@I must show you respect!
You're a higher rank in the dojo, too.@It doesn't matter what you call me!

group_1.textRight: Even after all these years, I'm still@not used to you calling me, "Sir."

group_1.textLeft: Anyway, about the exam!@It's coming up soon!

group_1.textRight: Slow down. [chara:801100:effect_emotion_sad_0][se:7224_fall_into]I haven't even taken the@exam yet, let alone passed it.

group_1.textLeft: With your sword skills, you'll @be worth 100 men to the force!

group_1.textRight: I don't think my sword skills@have anything to do with it…

group_1.textLeft: Of course they do!@They'll definitely come in handy!
The principles can be applied to anything!@Everything is connected!

group_1.textRight: *Chuckle* Well, thanks for believing in me.@It means a lot.

group_1.textLeft: The whole family believes in you, Sir!@Go make your dreams come true!
And off he went to turn his dreams into@reality.

group_1.textRight: So he's a good swordsman!@How good is he?

group_1.textLeft: Yeah he is! He's one of the strongest@swordsmen in the history of our dojo—

group_1.textRight: Hey, hey! Come on Asuka,@keep the story moving!
